snippet: Explosions and heavy fighting rocked Syria’s two largest cities on Saturday, witnesses and activists said, as the Syrian government and rebel fighters struggled to gain an advantage in the country’s bloody, 17-month-old conflict.
abstract: Explosions and heavy fighting rock Syria’s two largest cities, as the Syrian government and rebel fighters struggle to gain an advantage in the country’s bloody, 17-month-old conflict; Iran’s state news agency reports that unidentified armed groups have kidnapped 48 Iranians on the road to the Damascus airport after the Iranians visited a religious shrine, although the report has not been verified.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Aleppo, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Explosions and heavy fighting rocked Syria’s two largest cities on Saturday, witnesses and activists said, as the Syrian government and rebel fighters struggled to gain an advantage in the country’s bloody, 17-month-old conflict.

headline.seo: Syrian Fighting Reported Escalating in Aleppo and Damascus
headline.main: Intensified Syrian Fighting Reported in Battles for Damascus and Aleppo
headline.print_headline: Intensified Syrian Fighting Reported in Battles for Damascus and Aleppo
